item.title: Toronto Film ‘Dry Leaf’ Finds North American Home with Cinema Guild (EXCLUSIVE)
item.description: Cinema Guild has bought North American distribution rights to “Dry Leaf,” Georgian filmmaker Alexandre Koberidze’s follow up to “What Do We See When We Look at the Sky?”

item.title: ‘Dry Leaf’ Review: A Gorgeously Eccentric Road Trip Through Blurry Rural Georgia
item.description: In Alexandre Koberidze’s 2021 breakout “What Do We See When We Look at the Sky?” the audience is politely requested to momentarily close their eyes. The Georgian director’s una

item.title: Sho Miyake’s ‘Two Seasons, Two Strangers’ Wins at Locarno
item.description: Sho Miyake’s “Two Seasons, Two Strangers” has won Locarno’s top award, its Golden Leopard for titles playing in the Swiss festival’s main International Competition.

item.title: Sho Miyake’s ‘Two Seasons, Two Strangers’ Wins at Locarno
